direction.raw_text: & MARLEY Jenny sits on the couch. Marley stands at her feet, with his shoulders between her knees, his big head resting in her lap. His tail hangs flat between his legs. His eyes are turned up at her, and he whimpers softly. Jenny strokes his head a few times and then, with no warning, buries her face in the thick fur of his neck and begins sobbing. They stay like that for a moment, Marley statue- still, Jenny clutching him to her like an oversized doll. John stands there, watching Marley take care of her. No words, just being there. A lesson here. Her head down, Jenny raises one arm up towards John and John goes to the couch and wraps his arms around both of them. We then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh. He's... big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - LIVING ROOM - DAY 83 With difficulty, John holds back Marley to protect DEBBY --- 19, glasses, bookish, the house sitter -- from his affection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Close to a hundred pounds. (re: the leash struggle) He just wants to say hi. He won't hurt you. Just stand still and be calm. You're a dog person, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: well, actually -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: okay? John releases Marley who springs on Debby, knocking her back. Shooting Draft 3106/07 60.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay! I'm okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not supposed to do that. You have to knee him. Anyway, it won't happen the whole time. Just maybe when you come home. (handing her a binder) This is everything you need to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - DAY John and Jenny lug their suitcases across the front lawn to the car, Marley running around them. Debby's glancing through the binder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debby. Welcome to our home! Marley is a spirited dog who loves interaction. We've never left him before but we're sure he'll behave just as he does when we're at home. They kiss him goodbye. Get in the cab and go. Debby runs to Marley, grabs his leash and struggles with all her might to hold on to Marley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIRPLANE - DAY Coach. But this is 1991, and the planes fly half-full. John N reads about Ireland in the guide book. Jenny sees a woma with a child. She smiles. No tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are just a few things about Marley you need to know. He eats three times a day. If he looks starved, feed him again. Of course all this food has to go somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - BACKYARD - DAY Debby looks at the piles of orange poop everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use the red shovel and the blue bucket. Watch your step. Don't worry about the color. He likes mangoes. Marley & He Shooting Draft  61.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH COUNTRYSIDE - DAY John and Jenny enjoy the scenery. Sheep in the road surround their car. Jenny leans out, laughing, and takes a picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley's ears get a lot of wax buildup. Once or twice while we're gone, please use cotton balls and the blue ear- cleaning stuff to clean them out. Wear old clothes and try not to breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - KITCHEN - NIGHT Debby is throwing up in her mouth a little as she cleans Marley's ears. Marley loves it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley is an excellent watchdog. And in this neighborhood, that's a good thing. You can rest easy at night, knowing he's on the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - BEDROOM - NIGHT Debby, ears plugged, shades over her eyes, weeps in frustration as Marley HOWLS at the moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH TOWN - NIGHT John and Jenny stop at a bed-and-breakfast for the night. It's raining softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thunderstorms are his weak point. Well, one of his weak points. You can give him sedatives if you think a storm is arriving. He doesn't like them, so push them down into his throat as far as they go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - NIGHT DEBBY IS Marley is tearing through the house, terrified. chasing him with a bottle of tranquilizers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH B & B - NIGHT An Irish widow, MRS. BUTTERLY, leads them to their room. Marley & He Shooting Draft  62.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do not allow Marley to get up on any piece of furniture, chew on anything except his toys, drink out of the toilet - keep the lid closed and the brick on the lid -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - BATHROOM - NIGHT Debby is showering - and then starts SCREAMING. Marley has stuck his head through the shower curtain and is licking the water. Debby splashes water at him to make him go away. Marley, thinking she's playing, scrambles into the tub with her. She grabs the curtain, and it pops off the curtain rings one by one as in ",Psycho."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - actually, you might want to keep the bathroom door closed in general.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - NIGHT Debby has run out of the bathroom, a towel hastily wrapped around her. Marley chases her. He leaps - and returns to earth with the towel in his mouth. Debby SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - NIGHT Debby is standing on a coffee table, nude, swatting at an unseen Marley with a bunch of tall artificial flowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other than that, enjoy him! Thanks so much. Love, Jenny and John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH BEDROOM - NIGHT Four walls, four different floral wallpapers. Twin beds. Above one, the Sacred Heart of Jesus. Above the other, the Sacred Heart of Mary. Crucifixes everywhere you look, and a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: framed picture of Pope John XXIII.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUTTERLY And if you need anything during the night, I'm right next door. The blankets are wool. Good heat in them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, they're electric?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUTTERLY No, not in this house. My brother died in a fire, God rest him. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUTTERLY (CONT'D) In this room, actually. It's been re- papered. Good night. God bless. Jenny sits on the bed. The CREAKING is terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know we haven't had sex since... you know. But there's no way we're breaking the streak tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding. 'Cause it's not just God watching. God, his mother... (indicating next door) .and apparently his best friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH BEDROOM - LATER They are in separate beds, staring at the crucifix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's July, but I think I can see my breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't feel my toes. John gets out of his bed and into Jenny's. Much SQUEAKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God. Shhh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not the mattress. It's the shrieks of over-sexed souls in hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna join them? He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure, because we don't have to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help myself. Knowing it hasn't happened in this house in 50 years is a turn-on. They roll into each others' arms, the bed squeaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she's deaf...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IRISH B & B - DAY 98 The next morning. John and Jenny, looking flushed and relaxed, and slightly abashed, come downstairs. Mrs. Butterly looks at them sourly. So do the other guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They heard us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... He jumps as Mrs. Butterly slams the teapot on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUTTERLY Tea? (looks him in the eye) I'm off to Mass. Mrs. Butterly leaves. John and Jenny look at the other guests. They smile bravely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Any of you hear her bed squeaking last night? I hope she hits confession before Mass, that's all I can say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER B & B - DAY 99 Another widow, another room, another collection of religious artifacts. John smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A THIRD B & B - NIGHT 100 Jenny sits on the bed, smiles at the NOISE, starts taking off her shoes. John ushers the Owner out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHURCHILL ROAD - DAY 101 John and Jenny pull into the driveway. They see Debby, the house sitter, on the front steps with her bag packed. She's tired-looking, beat. She reaches for a pair of crutches. John gets out of his car, a smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Debby. So how was-- -Debby hurls the binder of instructions at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were eleven thunderstorms while you were away. Eleven! And you were right. He doesn't like thunderstorms!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, yeah, wow. Eleven, huh? That is a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And those goddamned dog tranquilizers don't work!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you give him four at a time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean on humans! She hobbles to the car, tries to get in with her crutches. They frustrate her and she ends up beating the ground with them until she throws them down. She's losing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as she gets in the car) And just so you know, I am a dog person. But that's not a dog! That's evil with a dog face! That's also humping your leg! Lose my number!! And she gets into her car and guns it, splintering the crutches as she peels out. John and Jenny, watch her go, turn and look at the front door. Marley's face in the little square window at the top, peeking out at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - DAY 102 A THUNDERSTORM outside. John sits at his desk, tries to work while Marley walks in circles. John looks at him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only thunder... John goes back to work. We hear more THUNDER, and Marley starts howling, knocks over a floor lamp... John looks off towards the bedroom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny?! Can you help me out here? I got twenty minutes to file this column! We follow John as he gets up from his desk, heads towards the back bedroom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny? We follow him into the room, an anxious Marley close at his heels. She's not here, he turns around just as she steps out of the bathroom, smiling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luck of the Irish... She holds up a pregnancy test with a clear BLUE line, her exuberant face lit up by a FLASH OF LIGHTNING. John goes to hug her, as Marley HOWLS in the b.g., we then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "Nine Months Later."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - BEDROOM - NIGHT 103 John and Jenny are asleep. Marley goes through his nighttime
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He chews through a sock. He drinks out of the toilet. He works on chewing through the plastic dog food tub. Another night and he'll be in. He chases a fly. Finally he goes to his bed on the floor of the bedroom. He settles himself down to sleep. He yawns, he scratches, he closes his eyes. He snores. And then - He wakes up, suddenly alert. He looks over at Jenny. He gets up, sits by her side of the bed, and waits. Suddenly Jenny sits up, rests a hand on her stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She catches her breath, leans over to John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John. John, wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - NIGHT Jenny has finished dressing. Suddenly she yelps in pain, doubles over. John takes her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! Suddenly, A GROWL. They turn to see Marley glaring at John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I'm not hurting her. Jenny MOANS again and now Marley's eyes narrow. He takes a step towards John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't scream, honey. He'll kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You put the car seat in this weekend, right? They won't let us take the baby home without the car seat installed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I'd forget that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 105 Panicking, John is struggling to get the car seat he forgot out of the box. He starts beating at the Styrofoam. Marley barks excitedly. John gets an idea, hands him one end of the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Marley. Help me out here. Do what you do best... Unsure, Marley licks the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't lick it, eat it! Destroy it! You can chew through drywall, man! I know you can do this! Marley catches on. He starts shredding the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GARAGE - NIGHT 106 John hurls a suitcase and the partially-assembled, partially- destroyed car seat into the back seat. He yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Car seat's in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - NIGHT 107 Jenny is tottering down the walk as John pulls out of the garage, gets her into the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR - NIGHT (STATIONARY) 108 JOHN Ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You? Marley barks from the back seat. They both turn and look at him. What's he doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - NIGHT 109 John opens the front door, drags Marley in. John gives him a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Here... Stay. Be good. Please, God. No storms. Stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - MORNING 110 The chew toy now almost completely gone. Marley sleeps beside it as we hear A KEY IN THE LOCK and he gets to his feet, greets John as he comes through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACKYARD - MORNING 111 As John let's Marley out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - MORNING 112 As John sets down a bowl of food, crouches down as Marley starts to eat. Marley & Me Blue Revisions 3/07/07 69.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the thing: in a couple of hours, we're gonna bring the baby home. And you'd be doing me a really big favor if you didn't freak out. (stands, sighs) I'm gonna try and do the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - MORNING 114 As the sun now streams in through the front windows down onto Marley, who is sound asleep. We hear A CAR DOOR CLOSE and he raises his head... A moment later, THE FRONT DOOR OPENS and John comes in and Marley greets him, jumps up on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, boy... let's go outside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACKYARD - MORNING 115 As Marley relieves himself, John yawning in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - MORNING 116 As Jenny unpacks her suitcase. Marley bounds into the room and greets her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Marley... She crouches down, gives him a kiss, rubs his back. And that's when we hear a small, birdlike chirp and the dog freezes. Where'd that come from? We hear the coo again and this time Marley lifts one paw in the air like a bird dog, and points in the direction of the car seat that we now see sitting on the bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I think would be a bummer? If he ate the baby... .Harley & Me Shooting Draft  70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves to the car seat and turns it around so that now we see the baby for the first time. She smiles at Marley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Patrick, Marley. Jenny unbuckles Patrick from the car seat and crouches down beside Marley and lets the dog sniff the baby's toes, then up his legs, finally his diaper which puts Marley into a Pampers stupor, the Holy Grail of aromas and Marley's eyes glaze...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, he's not gonna hurt him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I'm gonna have to put a lock on the diaper pail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - DAY 117 Garbage day, and the trash piled outside the Grogan house testifies to the change inside. Empty cartons of diapers, the packaging from a crib, a stroller, the car seats, the Pack'n'Play...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - DAY 118 Jenny tries to watch the baby, now crawling around on the floor and file her column over the phone at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have the quote right here-- Patrick crawls over Marley, who's supremely patient as Patrick takes a fistful of his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, have legal call them again and get a release for it. They told me it was on the record-- Marley-- Patrick, that's his eye-- No, not you, Karla, just get the release. I'll call you back. (HANGS UP) Be gentle, Patrick! Jenny leans back in her chair, rubs her face. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laundry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARK - DAY John sits on a bench, Marley at his feet reading "What to Expect in the First Year." He takes a breath, looks up, watches a COUPLE make out on a blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - MORNING The baby in his high chair. Jenny sets a few cheerios on the tray. Patrick picks them up and drops them, we follow them down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To where Marley waits, eagerly vacuuming up the cereal. It continues to RAIN CHEERIOS and we then BOOM BACK UP and see that Patrick is now eight months old, laughing as he throws the cereal onto the floor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACKYARD - NIGHT 121 John stands there letting Marley out. He looks back at the house, watches Jenny through the window as she sets Patrick down in his crib, shuts the light out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL - NIGHT 122 They're both working at their desks. Jenny looks up from her computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to go in tomorrow for a few hours, see my editor. Think you can watch the baby for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. John looks around the room. The place is a disaster area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, those younger, skinnier better looking people? Yeah, I think I remember them. Vaguely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I miss them. He turns back to his work. She looks at him, sets her pad aside, comes up behind him, puts her arms around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're still here. He looks up at their reflection in the window, not so sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - NIGHT 123 John and Jenny now asleep on opposite sides of the bed. On the floor beside John, Marley lifts his head and GROWLS. We then hear a piercing SCREAM coming from outside. The dog is already out of the room. John sits up, immediately starts to get out of bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, don't go out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay here. Call the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - SAME 124 Marley's at the door growling as John, in his boxer shorts, grabs the dog by the choke chain and opens the door. We hear another SCREAM coming from a couple houses down and Marley breaks through the screen, pulling John with him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - SPA 125 As other lights come on, NEIGHBORS start to come out onto the street. John runs to where we see THE TEENAGE GIRL NEXT DOOR bent over, sobbing, in her driveway beside her car, driver's door still open. John lets go of Marley and hurries to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said not to scream or he'd stab me, but I screamed... And John sees the blood on her shirt. He takes hold of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay okay okay, I've got you... (THEN) Where's your mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny'll call her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley sniffs at the ground, growling more and more intensely. We hear SHOUTING, "He went that way" as several neighbors take off running. Marley lifts his head and he, too, bolts into the night---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley! NO! But he's gone and John has to stay with the girl. We hear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she slides down the car and sits down on the ground. John sits down beside her, holding onto her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this time we've been living here, I never got your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're gonna be alright, Lisa, the police are on the way... John looks off, wondering where Marley is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - LATER 126 A crime scene. Jenny, clutching the baby, stands on the porch watching as an AMBULANCE pulls away. John, now in shorts and a T-shirt, comes jogging up the walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't find him anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should get in the car, drive around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get the keys... John's coming into the house when a police cruiser pulls to the curb in front of the house. A POLICEMAN gets out of the driver's side, then opens the back and leads Marley out. He bounds up the walk to the two of them who greet him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found him outside the 76 station on Radford. He had the guy cornered in the men's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you caught the guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jig caught the guy. He also gnawed the barrel of my shotgun, and ate half my radio mic. They look at Marley wagging his tail, panting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, the neighbors all said he belonged here, but none of them wanted to drive him, so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for bringing him home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helluva dog. John nods as The Officer heads back to his car. Jenny crouches down and gives Marley a big hug and a back rub...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BOCA RATON HOUSE - DAY 127 An upscale, newer money neighborhood. An OPEN HOUSE sign out front. John pulls up. He opens the door, holds up a hand to Marley who sits in the back--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay. --and starts to unhook Patrick from his car seat. Marley bolts out of the car and heads straight for the house...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BOCA RATON HOUSE - DAY 128 A REALTOR is showing a COUPLE around the large, empty, new house. She points out the designer kitchen that looks out onto the patio and pool, a huge yellow lab now leaping in. A moment later, we see John, clutching Patrick, enter the backyard, try to haul Marley out of the pool. He gives up, heads for the house, opens the back door and peers inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. The Realtor smiles awkwardly at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see a set-up, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly. (looks at the baby) First home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we live up in West Palm, over on Churchill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooooh. Well, I think you'd find this neighborhood to be quite a pleasant change. And now Marley bolts past him into the house, tracking wet footprints all over the floor, jumps up onto the REALTOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... my... hello...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, who's dog is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 345 CHURCHILL ROAD - DAY 129 John enters, carrying Patrick, supplies to fix the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny? A wet Marley bounds into the house, heads for the back. John follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM - SAME THE Jenny is crouched on the floor when John appears in doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. You alright? She stands up, smiles the best she can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Where you guys been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna show you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hands her the set up) A house. (before she can react) It's a little pricey, but I think we can do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, I know we've talked about it, but I'm not sure this is the right time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when would the right time be, Jen? After one of us gets stabbed in the driveway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, honey, we're cramped in here. This was supposed to be our three-year house, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but we can't afford to buy a new one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, we can. With both our salaries--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, about that... I don't think I'm gonna be able to keep working. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Are you sure? She steps away, revealing the counter where FOUR PREGNANCY TESTS are lined up, all with the same result: Positive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUN-SENTINAL OFFICE - DAY 131 John sits with Sebastian at his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already? I mean, how old's the one you got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About eight months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. Haven't you heard of birth control?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, sometimes it doesn't work. You know what else doesn't work? The one about how "A dog will stop your wife's biological clock."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm not the one, keeps getting her pregnant. John gives him a look, sees Arnie heading into his office, takes a breath and gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wish me luck.
direction.name: direction

You took a piece of crap About Towner and turned it into something fresh. (SITS BACK) I hate to break it to you, son, but you're a good columnist.

direction.raw_text: Baby, I got news for you, our life is wherever we are. And you're not happy here anymore, doing that column. You're restless, John. I feel it. I feel it when you read Sebastian's articles every day. And I feel it when you sit out in the driveway an extra five minutes before you come in. (THEN) Maybe it's time for a change.

direction.raw_text: I'm forty, Jen. Seems kinda late for that.

direction.raw_text: Not so late. She stands up in the dark, lifts her dress over her head.

direction.raw_text: What're you doing?

direction.raw_text: We're not old, John. We can still surprise ourselves. He sits there stunned as she now dives into the pool. She surfaces and smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. You want your other birthday present or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John can't get out of his clothes fast enough. He leaps the pool and swims over to her, kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not old. And then we hear ANOTHER splash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh... And a moment later Marley's head goes bobbing by.

direction.raw_text: . SUN-SENTINAL OFFICE - DAY out of his As John packs up his desk. Arnie sticks his head office.

direction.raw_text: Hey, Gorgan. John smiles to himself, walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to say good luck up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also, there's a good chance that every piece of advice I ever gave you, may in fact be total crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate it just the same. They stand there a moment, awkward. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This would be where a mushier guy would tell you he's proud of you, give you a hug, and send you on your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really glad you're not that guy, sir. Arnie nods, goes back into his office and shuts the door. Shooting Draft  101.

direction.raw_text: Hey, Marley! We're up here!

direction.raw_text: He can't hear you with the engine going.

direction.raw_text: (aside to Jenny) Not to mention the tranquilizers. I think he's already reached his cruising altitude.

direction.raw_text: is coming from beneath his feet. Clearly it's Marley. Passengers near them frown.

direction.raw_text: is that a dog?

direction.raw_text: What an imagination, huh? (MOUTHING IT:) We don't have a dog. He makes the crazy sign with his finger, gesturing at Patrick. The MOANING gets worse. John just smiles tightly.

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA COUNTRY ROAD - DAY 176 Fall foliage. Beautiful, picture-perfect countryside. The Grogan family car winds along the roads. Marley has his head out the window, tongue wagging...

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY 177 A two-story country house, no neighbors visible. Trees, land, woodpile, the whole country living thing. The Grogans pile out of the car, look at the house. Marley takes off running...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley! Marley jumps into a pile of leaves, scatters them everywhere, rolls over onto his back and knocks over a rake, which falls and breaks a basement window.

direction.raw_text: And... we're home.

John sits down at his cubicle, stares out the window at the city. His EDITOR, black, John's age, approaches with a much younger REPORTER...

direction.raw_text: Hey, John. Settling in okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine, thanks.

direction.raw_text: Good. I want you to meet Billy... He indicates the twenty-something guy beside him. John and Billy shake hands.

direction.raw_text: You're the Florida guy, right? The dog columns...

direction.raw_text: Well, some of them were, but--

direction.raw_text: Cute stuff. C'mon, I'll show you around.

direction.raw_text: It's here!

direction.raw_text: Okay, time for lunch!

direction.raw_text: I'll bring this in. Go on up. The kids and Marley head up to the house. John drags the toboggan up the hill. He pauses at the top and looks down at the toboggan run. He gets on the toboggan.

direction.raw_text: Honey, what're you doing?

direction.raw_text: I can't remember the last time I rode on a toboggan..
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Marley jumps onto John's lap as they get going...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying down the hill. Marley is much heavier than the kids, and they sail past the place where the kids stopped, through the woods, barely missing trees and low-hanging branches,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John! The creek! The toboggan bumps over the crest of a small hill and sails through the air, landing with a crash on the iced-over creek. John and Marley tumble into a snow bank on the opposite side. A moment. But then Marley jumps up and wriggles in delight. John painfully unfolds himself, checks for injuries. Marley comes up and romps with him.

direction.raw_text: Hey... wanna do it again?

direction.raw_text: John!

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT 183 From the low angle of the stairs, Patrick lies on his side, sleeping. And then we see Marley's head rise and reveal itself as Marley lifts it to look at John standing there. He'd been laying there on the bed behind Patrick. He looks at John, knows he's not supposed to be there, but...

direction.raw_text: That's alright, pal. I won't tell. (THEN) We kicked ass down that hill, didn't we? John smiles at him and continues up to bed.

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRY ROAD - AFTERNOON 184 Early Spring. The snow has melted. Marley, still as a statue, sits at the side of the road, waiting. Suddenly, he stands up and starts to wag his tail.

direction.raw_text: A moment later, a yellow dot appears on the horizon. As it gets closer, Marley gets more and more excited as we now see that the dot is a SCHOOL BUS. It pulls to a stop beside Marley. Conor and Patrick get off and are greeted by Marley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, boy. We HOLD WIDE ON THEIR BACKS as the boys start up the road towards home, Marley bounding between them, nipping at Patrick's backpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DUSK John pulls up as the boys now throw a football back and forth while Marley leaps into the air, trying to intercept it. John gets out of the car, claps his hands, holds them up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit me, I'm open! Patrick throws the ball to John who catches it, mocks stiff- arms his way to the front steps with the boys now hanging off him as he gives the play-by-play...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, look at Grogan-- two three- hundred pound linemen literally hanging off him, but he won't be denied! And now Marley jumps on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhh, out of nowhere, a brutal hit from the Strong Safety and the unthinkable happens... GROGAN GOES DOWN... And he collapses with the boys at the foot of the. steps, Marley all over them, licking whatever faces he can get. Colleen comes out the front door, stands at the top of the steps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mommy says dinner and take off your shoes.

direction.raw_text: Alright... c'mon guys... They all get up, start up the steps. Marley follows, takes one step when his hind legs buckle. John looks back at him.

direction.raw_text: You okay, boy? C'mon... Marley tries the second step and again his legs give out. He looks up at them...

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with him, Daddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's wrong. He's just tired. Right, Dad? John sees the way Patrick is looking at him, knows he's protecting his little brother.

direction.raw_text: That's right. Football just took it out of him. C'mon, let's give him a hand. And now the three of them go to Marley, help him up the stairs.

direction.raw_text: Too much color.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I mean, don't get me wrong, it's a good piece, but... you're reporting now, John. I want you to tell the story, I don't want you to be in the

direction.raw_text: All I'm saying is: less you, more facts.

direction.raw_text: 196 EXT. FRONT LAWN - NIGHT John and Jenny run to'a tree at the edge of the property. Marley lies on the ground, in a hollow, hidden from view from the hill above. His belly is swollen, his face drawn. It's clear he's very ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, boy, it's okay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VETERINARY TREATMENT ROOM - NIGHT John stands with DR. PLATT, a female vet. Marley lies on the floor in a dog bed, an IV is going into his paw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT He's on an IV for fluids and a sedative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT His stomach twisted. He ate or drank something quickly, took in a lot of air and his stomach flipped. I got a tube down which let out some of the gas. I think i untwisted it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he's okay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT For now. But once this happens, it almost always happens again. And if it does, there's not gonna be anything I can do. He's too old for that kind of surgery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it doesn't happen again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT More than likely, it will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what if it doesn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT I just think you should prepare yourself that he might not make it through the night. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT (CONT'D) (THEN) Maybe one percent of dogs ever survive
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One percent? What's that number based on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT Mr. Grogan--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what it's based on: regular dogs. (getting worked up) Lady, we are so far from 'regular", you have no idea. (INDICATES MARLEY) My guy here... He once ate an entire answering machine, and digested it. Then went back and ate the phone for dessert. So don't give me numbers like "one percent," because you don't know him. But I do, and I'll see him in the morning. We TRACK WITH JOHN as he storms out of the exam room, walks down the hall, goes through waiting room, then he PASSES US as he goes out into the dark parking lot, walks to his car and stops. We stay BEHIND HIM as he leans with one hand on his car, and doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - NIGHT Jenny's sitting at the table looking through a thick album when John comes in. She looks up at him expectantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just gonna have to wait and see. If he makes it through the night, I think we'll be alright. He notices the album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you looking at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your old columns. He's in a lot of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John rotates the album for a better look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saved these?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every one. He looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even on the crappiest day, when the boys were driving me nuts and the laundry wasn't done and a hundred other things were hard, I knew I had this. (taps the book) Five minutes of you. Sometimes they were funny and sometimes they were sad, or silly or whatever, but they were all you. And for those five minutes, you made me feel better. She gets up, comes over to him, leans down and kisses his head. Then, as she starts out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should read them. They're pretty great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAWN The sun just coming up. We hear A PHONE RING OVER.

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - SANE As John, his head on the table, asleep, pops up at the sound of the ring and grabs the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? (listens, then) Alright. Thank you. He hangs up, sees Jenny now standing in the doorway, tying her robe, looking at him anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's coming home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - EVENING As John pulls up. He gets out of the SUV, walks around and opens the back window and now Marley sits up into view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Marley's back! John opens the tail gate just as the kids come rushing onto the porch, Marley's tail wagging as he's lifted out of the car and set on the ground, the kids now surrounding him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SEBASTIAN'S APARTMENT - NEW YORK CITY - DAY Loft. Downtown. Full of unpacked boxes. A mattress on the floor. Expensive electronics sit atop their cartons. John follows Sebastian on a "tour."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice place. How long you been here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two years, little more. Sebastian sees John looking at all of the unpacked boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in and out of town so much I really haven't had a chance to settle in. I hired a decorator, but she and I got into a thing and it got messy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't, I still got one more interview to do. A Sebastian opens the fridge revealing nothing but beer and hunk of Parmesan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the piece again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, you told me that. So you're down in Philly now, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just outside. More space for the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta you got, five now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three. Here's a picture of everybody... John pulls a photo from his wallet, hands it to Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenny's holding up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignores the callowness) Yeah, she's great. And that's Colleen our youngest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with the ladybug get-up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling at the memory) Oh, yeah, that's a funny story. She had done this pageant at her preschool two weeks before, but she didn't wanna take off the costume, plus Marley went ballistic for the antenna which is why it looks like he's trying to eat her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that is funny. (returns the photo) So I was thinking later on maybe Thai? There's this new place in the meat Packing District. How's that sound? Be just like old times. John stands there a moment, feeling the distance between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, well, actually I'm headed back home later today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fact, I should probably get going...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. (awkward Man-pat hug) Good seeing you, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (walking him out) Oh, hey, be sure to check out the Delegates Lounge at the U.N... Great Mojitos, really hot interpreters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the tip. And John goes out the door. Sebastian takes out his blackberry, dials...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's Sea-bass. What're you up to tonight? (THEN) Oh. No, that's cool. Another time then. He hangs up, stands there in the middle of his big, empty apartment a moment. He then dials another number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's Sea-bass. What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY As a cab pulls away and John carries his suitcase up onto the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY John enters the house, sets down his suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Anybody home? He sees a note ("PICKING UP THE KIDS. J"), and peers into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where Marley is up on his hind legs, eating something off the counter. John puts his keys down, but Marley doesn't react. John sneaks up behind him. Marley keeps eating the grilled cheese sandwich off the plate...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley? Hey, boy. Marley looks up briefly as if he heard something, but then returns to eating. John is right behind him. John reaches out and touches Marley, and Marley jumps, totally guilty. Then he turns and greets John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, boy? You didn't hear me? Huh? He looks at the dog a moment, thoughtful, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go for a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILL - DAY As John walks Marley off leash up a hill. At one point, John has to stop and wait for Marley to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, boy, just a little further to the top... Marley comes up, panting, eyes wet and happy. John looks at him, can see how tired he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what, this is a good spot right here. John looks out at the valley below, settles down onto the damp earth beside Marley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just sit for a while. The two of them sit there, looking out at the beautiful countryside below. John strokes Marley for a moment. Looks at the grey hair, the tired eyes that now look back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. So... you're gonna tell me, right? When it's time? Because I don't wanna make that decision on my own. So you just let me know when you're ready, okay? Marley rests his chin on John's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UPPER HALLWAY - NIGHT Jenny is at the top of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marley? (turns to John) Have you seen him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not up here.

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A John and Jenny find Marley lying peacefully in front of the dying fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I could move his bed down here. John sits down beside Marley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man. He's always slept with us. Now he can't even make it upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks pretty comfortable to me. (THEN) I'll go get his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Jen? why don't you grab a blanket for me, too. She nods, starts back up the stairs. John grabs a pillow from the couch and lays down beside Marley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a good spot. I may never sleep upstairs again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey. Scooch over. He looks up and see that Jenny's brought a blanket. She lies down with them. John puts his arm around them both. Marley's tail begins gently pounding the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like old times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THUMP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHILADELPHIA INQUIRER - DAY John sits across from his editor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'd be twice a week. Six hundred words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's the subject?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyday stuff. The stuff we all go through. But funnier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it. I thought you came here to be a reporter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did, but I think we both know that isn't me. I'm a columnist. A good one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sticks her head in the office...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John-- your wife's on the phone. She says it's important...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right there. (to the editor) Think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY Jenny on the phone, looking out into the backyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't get him back inside. He's lying out there in cold... and he won't move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY Late afternoon. John's car pulls up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DINING ROOM - DAY 211 Jenny and Patrick are sitting on the floor. Marley is lying on the dining room floor, breathing heavily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patrick came home and we got him here. Dr. Platt said if he's comfortable, leave him here for a while and see. But he's no better. John kneels down by Marley, who looks at him but doesn't wag his tail or lick his hand. He runs his hand over his coat - then over his stomach, the dog flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking him in. The kids all come into the room, Colleen carrying a stuffed sheep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he sick again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he is, honey. But I'm going to take him to the hospital and they'll try to make him better. Conor bends down, nuzzles Marley's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get better, Mar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can take Lamby, okay? (she puts the stuffed animal next to him) But don't chew her other ear off. Patrick leans down, hugs Marley tightly and whispers right in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye. When he looks up at his father, John can see that Patrick's crying, that he knows what the other two don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VET'S - NIGHT 212 John lifts Marley out of the car. Marley seems a little more alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna walk? He sets him down gingerly. Hesitantly, Marley walks over to the tree that countless dogs have peed on, sniffs it, then looks around. John looks around, too. It's a crisp spring night in Pennsylvania. Takes a breath...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice night, huh? Marley looks around, then looks at John. There's something in his expression. John nods, knows what he's saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, boy. (as Marley moves close) Okay. John, his heart breaking, bends down to carry Marley up the front steps of the clinic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VET WAITING ROOM - LATER John stands as Dr. Platt comes out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT I did everything that worked before. But no luck. There's still surgery,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --not strong enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT There's blood in his stomach. The lining might be compromised. I don't know what we'll find if we go in there anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you give me a minute? I need to... I need to call my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT - NIGHT John's on his cell phone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. It's the stomach thing again. Nothing's working. They could do surgery, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Jenny listens to John on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Jenny nods as tears come. They stay on the phone, quiet, just being with each other. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT - NIGHT JOHN (INTO PHONE) I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXAMINING ROOM - NIGHT John enters. Marley is on the table, zonked out. Dr. Platt has put a blanket on the cold metal table so Marley is warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT I'll give you some time. She goes. John stares down at Marley. Takes the stuffed lamb out of his pocket, places it under a paw. When John puts a hand on his flank, Marley's eyes flutter open. His tail THUMPS gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, buddy. He pets Marley's head, runs his hands all over Marley's body. His coat, still shedding. His tail. He takes up each paw, each ear, remembering and memorizing at the same time. He leans down, puts his nose on Marley's neck and breathes him in. Then he goes around, squats down so he's on Marley's level. He looks into Marley's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, you know all that stuff we always said about you? What a total pain you are? The world's worst dog? Well, don't you believe it. Don't believe it for a minute. You loved us, every day, no matter what. And that's a pretty amazing thing. (he leans in) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I don't know where you're going from here, but you remember this: You're a great dog, Marley. You are a great dog.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BEGIN PULLING AWAY DOWN THE HALLWAY

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT 218 In the BEDROOM, Jenny sits on the bed, the phone in her hand, waiting, we BEGIN PULLING AWAY DOWN THE HALLWAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLINIC - NIGHT 219 Dr. Platt is in the room now. John, his hand on one of Marley's paws, kneels on the ground, looking at Marley, Marley lays on the table, looking right back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT He won't feel a thing. He'll just slip away. Are you ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at Marley) We're ready. Dr. Platt inserts the needle into the I.V. and presses the plunger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - NIGHT 220 As a pajama-clad Patrick slips a tape into the VCR...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLINIC - NIGHT 221 As we now HOLD ON MARLEY'S EYES, slowly beginning to close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT 222 As Jenny sits vigil by the phone, we CONTINUE PULLING BACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - NIGHT 223 As Patrick sits alone in the dark living room, his face illuminated by the TV, as he watches SILENT IMAGES from Grogan family home videos:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides on Marley's back through the house at 345 Churchill, young Marley's tail knocking over everything within range, toddler and dog both joyous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLINIC - NIGHT As Marley's eyes finally close. The CAMERA drifts to John's hand, stroking Marley's side. Dr. Platt listens to Marley's heart and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLATT He's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the dog on the table, the doctor discreetly going to the side, and John laying his head next to Marley and putting his arms around him as we now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PENNSYLVANIA HOUSE - DAY As the five Grogans walk across the-property. Colleen sits on John's shoulders. They reach a clearing where we see a small grave has been dug. John sets Colleen down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's wrapped in his blanket...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he'll be warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys want to read your letters?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine is a picture. Of me and Marley. And grasshoppers. And ice cream. Mommy wrote what I said. "Dear Marley. I will never forget you, forever." And those are kisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful, honey. He'll like it. Drop it in. Conor? Conor reads his piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Dear Marley. I loved you all my life. I hope you like heaven and that there's lots to chew on. Your brother, Conor Richard Grogan." John puts his hand on Conor's shoulder as Conor drops in the letter into the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patrick? Do you want to say anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to give him something. Jenny reaches behind her neck and unclasps the gold necklace John gave Jenny when she first got pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This little necklace has been on quite a journey. John smiles at her, remembering. So much shared history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your dad gave this to me to celebrate the beginning of our family. But you know what? Our family had already begun. She looks into the grave, gently sets the necklace atop the blanket, lets her hand rest there a moment, then stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye, Clearance Puppy.
direction.name: direction
